translations.text: روزی، هر کسی می‌آید و به دفاع از خود برمی‌خیزد (و جز درباره‌ی نجات خود نمی‌اندیشد، و پدران و مادران از فرزندان، فرزندان از پدران و مادران، خویشاوندان از نزدیکان، دوستان از رفیقان، و بالأخره همگان از همگان بیزار و گریزانند!) و به هر فردی پاداش و پادافره آنچه کرده است به تمام و کمال داده می‌شود و به هیچ کسی (کمترین) ستمی نمی‌شود. [[«یَوْمَ»: یاد کن روزی را که. خدا نسبت به مهاجران جهاد پیشه و شکیبا، دارای مغفرت و مرحمت است در روزی که ... مراد قیامت است. واژه (یَوْمَ) ظرف (رَحیمٌ) در آیه قبلی، یا مفعول به فعل محذوف (أُذْکُرْ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی [فرارسد] که هر کس [فقط] به دفاع از خویش بپردازد، و جزای هرکسی بر وفق کاری که کرده است، تمام و کمال داده شود، و بر ایشان ستم نرود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (به یاد آورید) روزی را که هر کس (در فکر خویشتن است؛ و تنها) به دفاع از خود برمی‌خیزد؛ و نتیجه اعمال هر کسی، بی‌کم و کاست، به او داده می‌شود؛ و به آنها ظلم نخواهد شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که آید هر کس بستیزد از جانب خویشتن و داده شود به هر که آنچه کرده است و ستم نشوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روزى كه هر كسى بيايد در حالى كه از خويشتن دفاع مى‌كند و به هر كس آنچه كرده تمام دهند و به آنان ستم نشود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی (که) هر کسی می‌آید در حالی که از خود دفاع می‌کند؛ و هر کسی به آنچه کرده بی‌کم‌وکاست پاداش می‌یابد در حالی که بر آنان ستم نرود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: On the day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be recompensed for what it had done, no one will be wronged.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The day when every soul will come quarrelling against itself, and every soul will be fully repaid for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The day that every soul shall come disputing in its own behalf; and every soul shall be paid in full for what it wrought, and they shall not be wronged.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beware a Day whereon each soul will come pleading for itself, and each soul will be paid in full that which it hath wrought, and they shall not be wronged.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Remember) the Day when every person will come up pleading for himself, and every one will be paid in full for what he did (good or evil, belief or disbelief in the life of this world) and they will not be dealt with unjustly.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah's judgement will come about them all on the Day when everyone shall come pleading in his defence, and everyone shall be fully requited for his deeds and none shall be wronged in the least.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Remember) the Day when every person will come pleading for himself, and every one will be paid in full for what he did, and they will not be dealt with unjustly.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be repaid what it did, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day [will come] when every soul will come pleading for itself and every soul will be recompensed fully for what it has done, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself and when every soul will be recompensed in full for what it did they shall not be wronged.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the Day of Judgment every soul shall try to defend itself and every soul will be justly recompensed.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (Remember) the day when every soul shall come, pleading for itself and every soul shall be paid in full what it has done, and they shall not be dealt with unjustly.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma tatee kullu nafsin tujadilu AAan nafsiha watuwaffa kullu nafsin ma AAamilat wahum la yuthlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day each soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be repaid according to whatever it has done, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: One Day every soul will come up struggling for itself, and every soul will be recompensed (fully) for all its actions, and none will be unjustly dealt with.

verses.text: وَ ضَرَبَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ مَثَلاً قَرْيَةً کَانَتْ‌ آمِنَةً مُطْمَئِنَّةً يَأْتِيهَا رِزْقُهَا رَغَداً مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ مَکَانٍ‌ فَکَفَرَتْ‌ بِأَنْعُمِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ فَأَذَاقَهَا اللَّهُ‌ لِبَاسَ‌ الْجُوعِ‌ وَ الْخَوْفِ‌ بِمَا کَانُوا يَصْنَعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و خدا [برای پندآموزی به ناسپاسان] مَثَلی زده است: شهری را که امنیت و آسایش داشت و رزق و روزیِ [مردمش] به فراوانی از همه جا برایش می آمد، پس نعمت خدا را ناسپاسی کردند، در نتیجه خدا به کیفر اعمالی که همواره مرتکب می شدند، بلای گرسنگی و ترس فراگیر را به آنان چشانید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خدا قريه‌اى را مثَل مى‌زند كه امن و آرام بود، روزى مردمش به فراوانى از هر جاى مى‌رسيد، اما كفران نعمت خدا كردند و خدا به كيفر اعمالشان به گرسنگى و وحشت مبتلايشان ساخت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خداوند شهرى را مثل زده است كه امن و آرام بود و رزقش به وفور از هر طرف به آن مى‌رسيد، اما كفران نعمت خدا كردند و خدا هم به سزاى آنچه انجام مى‌دادند طعم گرسنگى و هراس را به [مردم‌] آن چشانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خدا شهرى را مَثَل زده است كه امن و امان بود [و] روزيش از هر سو فراوان مى‌رسيد، پس [ساكنانش‌] نعمتهاى خدا را ناسپاسى كردند، و خدا هم به سزاى آنچه انجام مى‌دادند، طعم گرسنگى و هراس را به [مردم‌] آن چشانيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدا بر شما حکایت کرد و مثل آورد مثل شهری را که در آن امنیت کامل حکمفرما بود و اهلش در آسایش و اطمینان زندگی می‌کردند و از هر جانب روزی فراوان به آنها می‌رسید تا آنکه اهل آن شهر نعمتهای خدا را کفران کردند، خدا هم به موجب آن کفران و معصیت طعم گرسنگی و بیمناکی را به آنها چشانید و چون لباس، سراپای وجودشان را پوشاند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند (برای آنان که کفران نعمت می‌کنند، داستان) مردمان شهری را مثل می‌زند که در امن و امان بسر می‌بردند و از هر طرف روزیشان به گونه‌ی فراوان به سویشان سرازیر می‌شد، امّا آنان کفران نعمت خدا کردند، و خداوند به خاطر کاری که انجام دادند، گرسنگی و هراس را بدیشان چشانید (و نعمتها را از ایشان سلب گردانید و بلاها بدانان رسانید). [[«قَرْیَةً»: آبادی بزرگ. مراد شهر مکّه یا جز آن است. در هر صورت در اینجا مراد اهل آنجا است (نگا: أعراف / 4، هود / 102، محمّد / 13). بدل از (مَثَلاً) یا مفعول‌به دوم (ضَرَبَ) است که متضمّن معنی (جَعَلَ) می‌باشد (نگا: نحل / 75). «رَغَداً»: فراوان. آسان. حال یا صفت است (نگا: بقره / 35 و 58). «لِباسَ». جامه ... کنایه از احاطه و فراگیری است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خداوند [اهل‌] شهری را مثل زند که امن و آسوده به سر می‌برد و روزی آن از هر سو به خوشی و فراوانی می‌رسید، آنگاه به نعمتهای الهی کفران‌ورزید، و سپس خداوند به کیفر کار و کردارشان بلای فراگیر گرسنگی و ناامنی را به آنان چشانید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند (برای آنان که کفران نعمت می‌کنند،) مثلی زده است: منطقه آبادی که امن و آرام و مطمئن بود؛ و همواره روزیش از هر جا می‌رسید؛ امّا به نعمتهای خدا ناسپاسی کردند؛ و خداوند به خاطر اعمالی که انجام می‌دادند، لباس گرسنگی و ترس را بر اندامشان پوشانید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برزده است خدا مثَلی شهری که بود آسوده و آرام می‌آمدش روزیش فراوان از هر سوی پس کفر ورزید به نعمتهای خدا پس چشانیدش خداوند جامه گرسنگی و ترس را بدانچه بودند می‌کردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداوند شهرى را مَثَل مى‌زند كه امن و آرام بود، روزى آن به فراوانى از هر جاى مى‌رسيد، اما [مردم آن‌] نعمتهاى خداى را ناسپاسى كردند، پس خداوند به سزاى آن كارها كه مى‌كردند جامه گرسنگى و ترس به آنها چشانيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خدا (برای ناسپاسان) گروهی را مَثَل زده است که غرق در امن و امان بودند، در حالی که روزیشان از هر سو برایشان به گونه‌ای فراوان می‌رسید. پس نعمت‌های خدا را کفران کردند و خدا (هم) به سزای آنچه بر می‌ساخته‌اند، لباس گرسنگی و هراس را به آنان چشانید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God presents the example of a town which enjoyed peace and security, its provisions coming from everywhere in abundance, but it denied the favours of God; so God acquainted it with intimate hunger and fear (as punishment) for what they had done.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Allah has illustrated an example of a township – which dwelt in peace and security, its provisions coming in abundance from every side – in response the township started being ungrateful of Allah’s favours, therefore Allah made it taste the punishment by covering it with a cloak of starvation and fear, on account of their deeds.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: God has struck a similitude: a city that was secure, at rest, its provision coming to it easefully from every place, then it was unthankful for the blessings of God; so God let it taste the garment of hunger and of fear, for the things that they were working.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Allah propoundeth a similitude: a town which was secure and at rest, to which came the provision thereof plenteously from every place; then it ungratefully denied the favours of Allah; wherefore Allah made it taste the extreme of hunger and fear because of that which they were wont to perform.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Allah puts forward the example of a township (Makkah), that dwelt secure and well content; its provision coming to it in abundance from every place, but it (its people) denied the Favours of Allah (with ungratefulness). So Allah made it taste the extreme of hunger (famine) and fear, because of that (evil, i.e. denying Prophet Muhammad SAW) which they (its people) used to do.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And God cites the example of a town that was secure and peaceful, with its livelihood coming to it abundantly from every direction. But then it turned unappreciative of God’s blessings, so God made it taste the robe of hunger and fear, because of what they used to craft.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah sets forth the parable of (the people of) a town who were secure and content and whose sustenance came in abundance from every quarter. But then the people of the town showed ingratitude towards Allah for His bounties, so Allah afflicted them with hunger and fear in punishment for their evil deeds.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Allah gives the example of a township (Makkah), it was secure and peaceful: its provision coming to it in abundance from every place, but it (its people) denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste extreme hunger (famine) and fear, because of what they did.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Allah coineth a similitude: a township that dwelt secure and well content, its provision coming to it in abundance from every side, but it disbelieved in Allah's favours, so Allah made it experience the garb of dearth and fear because of what they used to do.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Allah draws a parable: There was a town secure and peaceful, its provision coming abundantly from every place. But it was ungrateful toward Allah’s blessings. So Allah made it taste hunger and fear because of what they used to do.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah strikes a parable of the village which was safe and peaceful. Its provisions came in abundance from everywhere; but it was thankless for the favors of Allah. Therefore, for what they were doing, Allah let it taste the garment of hunger and fear.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God tells a parable about a secure and peaceful town surrounded by abundant sustenance. Its inhabitants rejected the bounties of God and He caused them to suffer hunger and fear as a result of their deeds.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Allah sets forth a parable: (Consider) a town safe and secure to which its means of subsistence come in abundance from every quarter; but it became ungrateful to Allah's favors, therefore Allah made it to taste the utmost degree of hunger and fear because of what they wrought.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wadaraba Allahu mathalan qaryatan kanat aminatan mutmainnatan yateeha rizquha raghadan min kulli makanin fakafarat bianAAumi Allahi faathaqaha Allahu libasa aljooAAi waalkhawfi bima kanoo yasnaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God makes an example of a town that was secure and at ease, with provisions coming to it abundantly from every quarter. Then it showed ingratitude for God's blessings and God afflicted it with hunger and fear because of what they did.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Allah sets forth a Parable: a city enjoying security and quiet, abundantly supplied with sustenance from every place: Yet was it ungrateful for the favours of Allah: so Allah made it taste of hunger and terror (in extremes) (closing in on it) like a garment (from every side), because of the (evil) which (its people) wrought.

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ‌ رَسُولٌ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ فَکَذَّبُوهُ‌ فَأَخَذَهُمُ‌ الْعَذَابُ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ ظَالِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همانا پیامبری از خود آنان برای [هدایت] شان آمد، ولی او را تکذیب کردند، پس عذاب [خدا] آنان را در حالی که ستمکار بودند، فراگرفت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پيامبرى از خودشان به نزدشان آمد، تكذيبش كردند؛ و عذاب، آن ستمكاران را فروگرفت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانا فرستاده‌اى از خودشان به سوى آنها آمد، اما او را تكذيب كردند، پس در حالى كه ظالم بودند آنها را عذاب در گرفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به يقين، فرستاده‌اى از خودشان برايشان آمد، اما او را تكذيب كردند، پس در حالى كه ظالم بودند آنان را عذاب فرو گرفت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و رسولی از خود آنها بر آنها آمد ولی او را تکذیب کردند، و عذاب بر آنها فرا رسید در حالی که ستمکار بودند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پیغمبری از خود آنان به سوی ایشان آمد (و همگان را به آئین حق دعوت کرد) امّا آنان دروغگویش نامیدند (و دعوتش را نپذیرفتند)، پس عذاب (الهی) ایشان را در حال ستمگری فرو گرفت. [[«وَ هُمْ ظالِمُونَ»: در حالی که ظالم و ستمگر بودند. در حین ستمگریشان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی که پیامبری از خودشان به سوی آنان آمد، آنگاه او را دروغ‌زن انگاشتند، و سرانجام در حالی که ستمکار [مشرک‌] بودند، عذاب آنان را فرو گرفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پیامبری از خودشان به سراغ آنها آمد، او را تکذیب کردند؛ از این رو عذاب الهی آنها را فراگرفت در حالی که ظالم بودند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه بیامدشان پیمبری از ایشان پس تکذیبش کردند پس گرفت ایشان را عذاب حالی که بودند ستمگران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه آنان را فرستاده‌اى از خودشان بيامد، اما او را دروغگو انگاشتند، پس عذاب آنان را در حالى كه ستمكار بودند فروگرفت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی و درستی فرستاده‌ای از خودشان برایشان آمد، پس او را تکذیب کردند. پس در حالی که ظالم بودند آنان را عذاب فرو گرفت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: An apostle came to them who was one of them, but they called him a liar. Then they were seized by torment for they were sinners.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed a Noble Messenger came to them from among them – in response they denied him, and therefore the punishment seized them, and they were unjust.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: There came indeed to them a Messenger from amongst them, but they cried him lies; so they were seized by the chastisement while they were evildoers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly there came to them an apostle from among them, but they belied him, wherefore the torment took hold of them while yet they were wrong-doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, there had come unto them a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) from among themselves, but they denied him, so the torment overtook them while they were Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A messenger from among them had come to them, but they denounced him, so the punishment seized them in the midst of their wrongdoing.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Most certainly a Messenger came to them from among them; but they rejected him, calling him a liar. Therefore chastisement seized them while they engaged in wrong-doing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: There has come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him, so the torment seized them while they were wrongdoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them, but they had denied him, and so the torment seized them while they were wrong-doers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly there had come to them an apostle from among themselves, but they impugned him. So the punishment seized them while they were doing wrong.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: A Messenger from their own was sent to them, but they belied him. So while they were harmdoers they were seized by the punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: A Messenger from their own people came to them and they called him a liar. Torment struck them because of their injustice.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly there came to them an Apostle from among them, but they rejected him, so the punishment overtook them while they were unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad jaahum rasoolun minhum fakaththaboohu faakhathahumu alAAathabu wahum thalimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: There came to them a messenger from among themselves, but they rejected him as false, so punishment overtook them, as they were wrongdoers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And there came to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they falsely rejected him; so the Wrath seized them even in the midst of their iniquities.

verses.text: فَکُلُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَکُمُ‌ اللَّهُ‌ حَلاَلاً طَيِّباً وَ اشْکُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ إِيَّاهُ‌ تَعْبُدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از نعمت هایی که خدا روزی شما کرده است، حلال وپاکیزه بخورید، و نعمت خدا را سپاس گزارید، اگر تنها خدا را می پرستید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از اين چيزهاى حلال و پاكيزه كه خدا به شما روزى داده است بخوريد و اگر خدا را مى‌پرستيد شكر نعمتش را به جاى آوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس، از آنچه خدا شما را روزى كرده است حلال و پاكيزه بخوريد و نعمت خدا را شكر گزاريد اگر تنها او را بندگى مى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، از آنچه خدا شما را روزى كرده است، حلال [و] پاكيزه بخوريد، و نعمت خدا را -اگر تنها او را مى‌پرستيد- شكر گزاريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس شما (مؤمنان از حال آنها عبرت گیرید و) از آنچه خدا روزی حلال و طیّب شما قرار داده تناول کنید و شکر نعمت خدا به جای آرید اگر حقیقتا خدا را می‌پرستید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (حال که چنین است، شما ای مؤمنان! همچون ایشان نباشید و) از روزیهای حلال و پاکیزه‌ای بخورید که خدا قسمت شما می‌گرداند، و شکر نعمت خدا را به جا آورید، اگر وی را می‌پرستید (و جز او را عبادت و پرستش نمی‌کنید). [[«حَلالاً طَیِّباً»: در حالی که حلال و پاکیزه باشد. حال اوّل و دوم (ما) است (نگا: بقره / 168، مائده / 88، أنفال / 69، یونس / 59).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از آنچه خداوند روزیتان کرده است، حلال و پاکیزه بخورید، و اگر فقط او را می‌پرستید، بر نعمت الهی شکر کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس، از آنچه خدا روزیتان کرده است، حلال و پاکیزه بخورید؛ و شکر نعمت خدا را بجا آورید اگر او را می‌پرستید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بخورید از آنچه روزی داد شما را خدا حلال پاکیزه و سپاس گزارید نعمت خدا را اگر هستید وی را پرستندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، از آن چيزهاى پاكيزه كه خدا روزيتان كرده بخوريد، و نعمت خداى را سپاس بداريد، اگر او را مى‌پرستيد و بس.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس از آنچه خدا شما را روزی داده است حلال و پاکیزه‌ای بخورید و نعمت خدا را - اگر تنها او را می‌پرستید - شکر گزارید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Eat the good and lawful of things that God has given you, and be grateful for the bounty of God, if you really worship Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore eat the lawful and good sustenance Allah has provided you, and be grateful for the blessings of your Lord, if you worship Him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So eat of what God has provided you lawful and good; and be you thankful for the blessing of God, if it be Him that you serve.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So eat of that which Allah hath provided you of lawful and clean things, and give thanks for Allah's favour, if it is He whom ye are went to Worship.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah has provided for you. And be grateful for the Graces of Allah, if it is He Whom you worship.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Eat of the lawful and good things God has provided for you, and be thankful for God’s blessings, if it is Him that you serve.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So eat out of the lawful and good sustenance that Allah has bestowed upon you, and thank Allah for His bounty, if it is Him that you serve.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah has provided for you. And be grateful for Allah's favor, if it is He Whom you worship.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah hath provided for you, and thank the bounty of your Lord if it is Him ye serve.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So eat out of what Allah has provided you as lawful and good, and give thanks for Allah’s blessing, if it is Him that you worship.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Eat of the lawful and good things with which Allah has provided you and be thankful for the favors of Allah if it is He you worship.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (People), consume the pure and lawful sustenance which God has given to you and thank God for his bounty if you are His true worshippers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore eat of what Allah has given you, lawful and good (things), and give thanks for Allah's favor if Him do you serve.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fakuloo mimma razaqakumu Allahu halalan tayyiban waoshkuroo niAAmata Allahi in kuntum iyyahu taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So eat the lawful and good things which God has provided for you, and be thankful for the blessing of God, if it is Him you worship.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So eat of the sustenance which Allah has provided for you, lawful and good; and be grateful for the favours of Allah, if it is He Whom ye serve.

verses.text: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ‌ عَلَيْکُمُ‌ الْمَيْتَةَ وَ الدَّمَ‌ وَ لَحْمَ‌ الْخِنْزِيرِ وَ مَا أُهِلَ‌ لِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ‌ بِهِ‌ فَمَنِ‌ اضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍ‌ وَ لاَ عَادٍ فَإِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خدا فقط مردار وخون و گوشت خوک و آنچه را با نام غیر خدا ذبح کرده اند، بر شما حرام کرده است؛ پس کسی که [برای نجات جانش از خطر، به خوردن آنها] ناچار شود در حالی که خواهان لذت نباشد و از حد لازم تجاوز نکند [گناهی بر او نیست] یقیناً خدا بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خدا حرام كرده است بر شما مردار و خون و گوشت خوك و هر چه را جز به نام خدا ذبح كرده باشند. اما كسى كه ناچار شود هرگاه بى‌ميلى جويد و از حد نگذراند، خدا آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه خدا مردار و خون و گوشت خوك و آنچه را كه به غير نام خدا ذبح شده بر شما حرام كرده است. پس كسى كه به خوردن آنها ناگزير شود و از حدّ [ضرورت و حكم خدا تجاوز] نكند، قطعا خداوند آمرزنده‌ى مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه [خدا] مردار و خون و گوشت خوك و آنچه را كه نام غير خدا بر آن برده شده حرام گردانيده است. [با اين همه،] هر كس كه [به خوردن آنها] ناگزير شود، و سركش و زياده‌خواه نباشد، قطعاً خدا آمرزنده مهربان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا بر شما بندگان تنها مردار و خون و گوشت خوک و آنچه را که به نام غیر خدا ذبح کنند حرام گردانید، و اگر کسی مضطر و ناچار شود بی‌آنکه قصد تجاوز (از اندازه) و تعدی (از حکم خدا) نماید (باز از همین حرامها به قدر ضرورت تناول کند) خدا البته بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آنچه را که مشرکان حرام می‌دانند، حرام نیست، بلکه خداوند) تنها مردار و خون و گوشت خوک و آنچه نام غیرخدا (به هنگام ذبح) بر آن گفته شده باشد (و به نام بتان و شبیه آنها سر بریده شود) بر شما حرام کرده است. ولی اگر آن کس که مجبور شود (به خاطر حفظ جان، از آن اشیاء حرام بخورد) در صورتی که علاقه‌مند (به خوردن و لذّت بردن از چنین چیزهائی) نبوده و متجاوز (از حدّ سدّ جوع هم) نباشد، (بر آنان ایرادی نیست؛ چرا که) خداوند بس آمرزنده و مهربان است. [[«إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ ...»: (نگا: بقره / 173، أنعام / 145).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدانید [که خداوند] بر شما مردار و خون و گوشت خوک و آنچه نامی جز نام خدا [به هنگام ذبحش‌] برده باشند، حرام کرده است، اما اگر کسی درمانده شود، و تجاوزکار و زیاده خواه نباشد [و از آنها بخورد، بداند که‌] خداوند آمرزگار مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند، تنها مردار، خون، گوشت خوک و آنچه را با نام غیر خدا سر بریده‌اند، بر شما حرام کرده است؛ امّا کسانی که ناچار شوند، در حالی که تجاوز و تعدّی از حدّ ننمایند، (خدا آنها را می‌بخشد؛ چرا که) خدا بخشنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز این نیست که حرام کرد بر شما مردار و خون و گوشت خوک و آنچه را نام جز خدا به آن برده شود پس آنکه ناچار گردد نه ستمگر و نه تجاوزکننده همانا خدا است آمرزنده مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه بر شما حرام كرده است: مردار و خون و گوشت خوك و آنچه را كه [به هنگام كشتن‌] نام غير خدا بر آن برداشته‌اند، و هر كه [به خوردن اينها] ناچار شود بى‌آنكه ستمگر باشد- كه از روى سركشى يا براى لذت‌جويى بخورد- و از حد بگذرد- بيش از نياز بخورد- پس همانا خدا آمرزگار و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (خدا) تنها مردار و خون (ریخته شده) و گوشت خوک و آنچه را (به هنگام ذبح‌) نام غیر خدا بر آن برده شده حرام گردانیده است. (با این همه) هرکس (که به خوردن آنها) ناگزیر شود، در حالی که ستمکار و جویای اضطرار و (نیز) برگشت‌کننده‌(ی به این) حرام نباشد؛ خدا بی‌گمان بسی پوشنده‌ی رحمتگر بر ویژگان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He has forbidden carrion and blood and the flesh of the swine, and what has been killed in the name of any other but God; but if one is driven by necessity (to eat it) without craving or reverting to it, then God is forgiving and kind.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Only these are forbidden for you – the carrion, and blood, and flesh of swine, and that which has been slaughtered while proclaiming the name of any other besides Allah; so one who is compelled and does not eat out of desire, nor more than what is necessary, then indeed Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: These things only He has forbidden you: carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, what has been hallowed to other than God. Yet whoso is constrained, not desiring nor transgressing, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He hath only disallowed unto you the dead-meat and blood and swine-flesh and that over which is invoked the name of other than Allah. Then whosoever is driven by necessity, not alusting nor transgressing verily Allah Is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He has forbidden you only Al-Maytatah (meat of a dead animal), blood, the flesh of swine, and any animal which is slaughtered as a sacrifice for others than Allah (or has been slaughtered for idols etc. or on which Allah's Name has not been mentioned while slaughtering). But if one is forced by necessity, without wilful disobedience, and not transgressing, then, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He has forbidden you carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and anything consecrated to other than God. But if anyone is compelled by necessity, without being deliberate or malicious, then God is Forgiving and Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah has forbidden you only carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine; also any animal over which the name of any other than Allah has been pronounced. But whoever eats of them under compelling necessity - neither desiring it nor exceeding the limit of absolute necessity - surely for such action Allah is Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He has only forbidden dead flesh, blood, the flesh of swine, and any animal which is slaughtered as a sacrifice for other than Allah. But if one is forced by necessity, without willful disobedience, nor transgressing, then, Allah is Pardoning, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He hath forbidden for you only carrion and blood and swineflesh and that which hath been immolated in the name of any other than Allah; but he who is driven thereto, neither craving nor transgressing, lo! then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He has forbidden you only carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been offered to other than Allah. But if someone is compelled [to eat any of that], without being rebellious or aggressive, indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: These things alone He has forbidden to you: what is already dead, blood, the flesh of swine, what has been offeredup to other than Allah. But to whoever is forced to eat any of these, neither desiring nor wanting to transgress, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The only things which are made unlawful for you are the flesh of dead animals, blood, pork and that which is not consecrated with the Name of God. But in an emergency, without the intention of transgression and rebellion, (it is not an offense for one to consume such things). God is certainly All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He has only forbidden you what dies of itself and blood and flesh of swine and that over which any other name than that of Allah has been invoked, but whoever is driven to necessity, not desiring nor exceeding the limit, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innama harrama AAalaykumu almaytata waalddama walahma alkhinzeeri wama ohilla lighayri Allahi bihi famani idturra ghayra baghin wala AAadin fainna Allaha ghafoorun raheemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He has forbidden you only carrion, blood and the flesh of swine; also any [flesh] consecrated in the name of any but God. But if anyone is forced by dire necessity, not desiring it or exceeding his immediate need, God is forgiving and merciful towards him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He has only forbidden you dead meat, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and any (food) over which the name of other than Allah has been invoked. But if one is forced by necessity, without wilful disobedience, nor transgressing due limits,- then Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: وَ لاَ تَقُولُوا لِمَا تَصِفُ‌ أَلْسِنَتُکُمُ‌ الْکَذِبَ‌ هٰذَا حَلاَلٌ‌ وَ هٰذَا حَرَامٌ‌ لِتَفْتَرُوا عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ الْکَذِبَ‌ إِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ يَفْتَرُونَ‌ عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ الْکَذِبَ‌ لاَ يُفْلِحُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به سبب دروغی که زبانتان گویای به آن است، نگویید: این حلال است و این حرام، تا به دروغ به خدا افترا بزنید [که این حلال و حرام حکم خداست]؛ مسلماً کسانی که به خدا دروغ می بندند، رستگار نخواهند شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا بر خدا افترا بنديد، براى هر دروغ كه بر زبانتان مى‌آيد مگوييد كه اين حلال است و اين حرام. كسانى كه به خداوند دروغ مى‌بندند رستگار نمى‌شوند؛

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در باره آنچه زبانتان به دروغ و بى‌سند توصيف مى‌كند، نگوييد اين حلال است و آن حرام، تا بر خدا دروغ بسته باشيد. زيرا كسانى كه بر خدا دروغ مى‌بندند رستگار نمى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و براى آنچه زبان شما به دروغ مى‌پردازد، مگوييد: «اين حلال است و آن حرام » تا بر خدا دروغ بنديد، زيرا كسانى كه بر خدا دروغ مى‌بندند رستگار نمى‌شوند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و شما نباید از پیش خود به دروغ چیزی را حلال و چیزی را حرام گویید و به خدا نسبت دهید تا بر خدا دروغ بندید، که آنان که بر خدا دروغ بندند هرگز روی رستگاری نخواهند دید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خداوند حلال و حرام را برایتان مشخّص کرده است) و به خاطر چیزی که تنها (از مغز شما تراوش کرده و) بر زبانتان می‌رود، به دروغ مگوئید: این حلال است و آن حرام، و در نتیجه بر خدا دروغ بندید. کسانی که بر خدا دروغ می‌بندند، رستگار نمی‌گردند. [[«لِمَا تَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُکُمْ»: به خاطر چیزی که سخنی بیش نیست و تنها بر زبانتان می‌رود، و پشتوانه‌ای از وحی آسمانی و دلیل عقلانی ندارد. (الْکَذِبَ): مفعول‌به (لا تَقُولُوا) است. «هذا حَلالٌ وَ هذا حَرامٌ»: بدل (الْکَذِبَ) است. «لِتَفْتَرُوا عَلَی اللهِ الْکَذِبَ»: تا بر خدا دروغ بندید. مراد این است که چون آنان به دروغگوئی عادت دارند، بر خدا نیز دروغ می‌بندند. یا این که: «الْکَذِبَ»: مفعول‌به (تَصِفُ) است، و لام در (لِما) تعلیلیّه و (ما) مصدریّه، و (لِتَفْتَرُوا) بدل تعلیل است، و لام (لِتَفْتَرُوا) لام صَیْرُورت و عاقبت بشمار است. یعنی: نگوئید این حلال است و آن حرام، به خاطر دروغهای محضی که زبانتان بیانگر آنها است (نگا: تفسیر قاسمی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و با هر دروغی که به زبانتان می‌آید، مگویید که این حلال است و این حرام، تا بر خداوند دروغ بسته باشید، زیرا کسانی که بر خداوند دروغ ببندند رستگار نمی‌شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به خاطر دروغی که بر زبانتان جاری می‌شود (و چیزی را مجاز و چیزی را ممنوع می‌کنید،) نگویید: «این حلال است و آن حرام»، تا بر خدا افترا ببندید به یقین کسانی که به خدا دروغ می‌بندند، رستگار نخواهند شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نگوئید بدانچه می‌ستاید زبانهای شما به دروغ این است حلال و این است حرام تا ببندید بر خدا دروغ را همانا آنان که بندند بر خدا دروغ را رستگار نشوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و با دروغى كه بر زبانتان مى‌رود مگوييد: اين حلال است و آن حرام، تا بر خدا دروغ بنديد. همانا كسانى كه بر خدا دروغ بندند رستگار نخواهند شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به آنچه زبان شما به دروغ می‌پردازد، مگویید: «این حلال است و این حرام.‌» تا بر خدا افترایی دروغین بزنید. به‌راستی کسانی که بر خدا افترای دروغ می‌بندند (خود و دیگران را) رستگار نمی‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do not utter the lies your tongues make up: "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," in order to impute lies to God; for they who impute lies to God will not find fulfilment.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And do not say – the lie which your tongues speak – “This is lawful, and this is forbidden” in order to fabricate a lie against Allah; indeed those who fabricate lies against Allah will never prosper.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And do not say, as to what your tongues falsely describe, 'This is lawful; and this is forbidden, so that you may forge against God falsehood; surely those who forge against God falsehood shall not prosper.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And say not concerning that wherein Your togues utter a lie: this is lawful, and this is unlawful, that ye may fabricate a lie againt Allah, verily those who fabricate lie against Allah shall not fare well.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And say not concerning that which your tongues put forth falsely: "This is lawful and this is forbidden," so as to invent lies against Allah. Verily, those who invent lies against Allah will never prosper.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And do not say of falsehood asserted by your tongues, “This is lawful, and this is unlawful,” in order to invent lies and attribute them to God. Those who invent lies and attribute them to God will not succeed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And do not utter falsehoods by letting your tongues declare: "This is lawful" and "That is unlawful," thus fabricating lies against Allah. Surely those who fabricate lies against Allah will never prosper.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And do not describe what your tongues have lied about, saying: "This is lawful and this is forbidden," to invent lies against Allah. Verily, those who invent lies against Allah, will never succeed.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And speak not, concerning that which your own tongues qualify (as clean or unclean), the falsehood: "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so that ye invent a lie against Allah. Lo! those who invent a lie against Allah will not succeed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do not say, asserting falsely with your tongues, ‘This is lawful, and that is unlawful,’ attributing lies to Allah. Indeed those who attribute lies to Allah will not be felicitous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And do not say what your tongues falsely describe 'This is lawful, and that is forbidden' in order to forge a lie about Allah. Indeed, those who forge a lie about Allah shall never prosper.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Unbelievers), do not follow whatever your lying tongues may tell you is lawful or unlawful to invent lies against God. Those who invent lies against God will have no happiness.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And, for what your tongues describe, do not utter the lie, (saying) This is lawful and this is unlawful, in order to forge a lie against Allah; surely those who forge the lie against Allah shall not prosper.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala taqooloo lima tasifu alsinatukumu alkathiba hatha halalun wahatha haramun litaftaroo AAala Allahi alkathiba inna allatheena yaftaroona AAala Allahi alkathiba la yuflihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do not falsely declare, "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so as to invent a lie against God. Surely, those who invent a lie against God do not prosper --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But say not - for any false thing that your tongues may put forth,- "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so as to ascribe false things to Allah. For those who ascribe false things to Allah, will never prosper.

verses.text: مَتَاعٌ‌ قَلِيلٌ‌ وَ لَهُمْ‌ عَذَابٌ‌ أَلِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [با این کارهای زشت] بهره و برخورداری اندکی [در زندگی دنیا دارند] و برای آنان [در قیامت] عذابی دردناک است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اندك بهره‌اى مى‌برند و در عوض به عذابى دردآور گرفتار مى‌آيند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بهره‌ى كمى است [كه در اين دنيا نصيبشان مى‌شود] ولى عذابى دردناك در انتظار آنهاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [ايشان راست‌] اندك بهره‌اى، و[لى‌] عذابشان پر درد است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (آنچه از این طریق به دست آورند) متاعی قلیل است و (در آخرت) عذابی دردناک خواهند داشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (سودجوئی و بهره‌مندی ایشان از جهان ناچیز است و تمام دنیا با توجّه به آخرت) کالای کمی است و عذاب دردناکی (پس از پایان زندگی دنیوی) دارند. [[«مَتَاعٌ»: کالا. تمتّع و لذّت. خبر مبتدای محذوف است. تقدیر چنین است: ذاکَ مَتاعٌ قَلیلٌ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برخورداری اندکی است و [سپس‌] بر ایشان عذابی دردناک [در پیش‌] است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بهره کمی است (که در این دنیا نصیبشان می‌شود)؛ و عذاب دردناکی در انتظار آنان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: کامیابی است اندک و ایشان را است عذابی دردناک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [اين كه دارند] بهره‌اى است اندك، و آنان را عذابى است دردناك.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این (بهره‌ی دنیوی) متاعی است اندک و برایشان عذابی است پر درد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For them there is some enjoyment, but the punishment is painful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: A little enjoyment – and for them is a punishment, most painful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: A little enjoyment, then for them awaits a painful chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A brief enioyment, and unto them shall be a torment afflictive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A passing brief enjoyment (will be theirs), but they will have a painful torment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A brief enjoyment—then they will have a painful punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Brief is their enjoyment of the world, and thereafter they shall suffer a painful chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A passing brief enjoyment (will be theirs), but they will suffer a painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A brief enjoyment (will be theirs); and theirs a painful doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [Their share of the present life is] a trifling enjoyment, and there will be a painful punishment for them.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Brief (is their) enjoyment, after which a painful punishment awaits them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Such an invention) will bring only a little enjoyment but will be followed by painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A little enjoyment and they shall have a painful punishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: MataAAun qaleelun walahum AAathabun aleemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: their enjoyment of this life is brief, and they shall have a painful punishment.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (In such falsehood) is but a paltry profit; but they will have a most grievous Penalty.

verses.text: وَ عَلَى‌ الَّذِينَ‌ هَادُوا حَرَّمْنَا مَا قَصَصْنَا عَلَيْکَ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ وَ مَا ظَلَمْنَاهُمْ‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ کَانُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ‌ يَظْلِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنچه را پیش از این برای تو شرح دادیم، بر یهود حرام کردیم، ما به آنان ستم نورزیدیم، بلکه آنان خودشان به خود ستم می کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر يهوديان آنچه را كه پيش از اين براى تو حكايت كرديم حرام كرده بوديم. ما به آنها ستم نكرده‌ايم، آنان خود به خويشتن ستم كرده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما بر يهوديان آنچه را پيش‌تر بر تو حكايت نموديم حرام كرده بوديم، و ما در حق آنها ستم نكرديم بلكه آنها خود به خويشتن ستم مى‌كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بر كسانى كه يهودى شدند، آنچه را قبلا بر تو حكايت كرديم، حرام گردانيديم، و ما بر آنان ستم نكرديم، بلكه آنها به خود ستم مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما همان چیزها که بر تو پیش از این شرح کردیم (از مردار و خون و خنزیر و ذبیحه به نام غیر خدا) بر یهودیان حرام کردیم، و ما بر آنان ستم نکردیم لیکن آنها خود بر نفس خویش ستم می‌کردند (که حلال خدا را حرام کردند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما بر یهودیان چیزهائی را حرام کرده‌ایم که قبلاً (در سوره‌ی أنعام، آیه‌ی 146) برای تو روایت نموده‌ایم (و این محرّمات، به عنوان مجازات تمرّد و کیفر ستم ایشان بوده است) و ما (با این تحریم) بر آنان ستم نکرده‌ایم و بلکه ایشان (به سبب ظلم و جلوگیری از راه خدا و دریافت ربا و خوردن مال مردم) به خویشتن ستم روا داشته‌اند. [[«مَا قَصَصْنَا ...»: (نکا: أنعام / 146، نساء / 160 و 161).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر یهودیان، آنچه را پیشتر بر تو خوانده‌ایم، حرام کرده‌ایم، و ما در حق ایشان ستم نکردیم، بلکه خود بر خویشتن ستم کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چیزهایی را که پیش از این برای تو شرح دادیم، بر یهود حرام کردیم؛ ما به آنها ستم نکردیم، اما آنها به خودشان ظلم و ستم می‌کردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بر آنان که جهود شدند حرام کردیم آنچه را فروخواندیم بر تو از پیش و ستم نکردیم بر ایشان لیکن بودند خویش را ستم می‌کردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بر جهودان آنچه را كه پيش از اين بر تو برگفتيم حرام كرديم و ما بر آنان ستم نكرديم بلكه آنها بر خود ستم مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بر کسانی که یهودی شدند، آنچه را قبلاً بر تو حکایت کردیم حرام گردانیدیم. و ما به آنان ستم نکردیم، بلکه آنان (خود) به خودشان ستم می‌کرده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have already told you what We have forbidden the Jews. We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And especially for the Jews We forbade which We related to you earlier; and We did not oppress them, but it is they who wronged themselves.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And those of Jewry -- We have forbidden them what We related to thee before, and We wronged them not, but they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And un to those who are Judaised We disallowed that which We have already recounted unto thee; and We wronged them not, but themselves they were wont to Wrong.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And unto those who are Jews, We have forbidden such things as We have mentioned to you (O Muhammad SAW) before [in Surat-Al-An'am, (The Cattle), see Verse 6:146]. And We wronged them not, but they used to wrong themselves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For those who are Jews, We have prohibited what We related to you before. We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong their own selves.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have already recounted to you what We prohibited to the Jews. In so doing We did not wrong them; it is they who wronged themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And for those who are Jews, We have forbidden such things as We have mentioned to you before. And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And unto those who are Jews We have forbidden that which We have already related unto thee. And We wronged them not, but they were wont to wrong themselves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We forbade to the Jews what We have recounted to you earlier, and We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have forbidden the Jews what We have already related to you. We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had made unlawful for the Jews all that we told you before. We did not do any wrong to them but they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And for those who were Jews We prohibited what We have related to you already, and We did them no injustice, but they were unjust to themselves.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaAAala allatheena hadoo harramna ma qasasna AAalayka min qablu wama thalamnahum walakin kanoo anfusahum yathlimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We forbade the Jews those things We told you about before. We did not wrong them; rather they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To the Jews We prohibited such things as We have mentioned to thee before: We did them no wrong, but they were used to doing wrong to themselves.

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ لِلَّذِينَ‌ عَمِلُوا السُّوءَ بِجَهَالَةٍ ثُمَ‌ تَابُوا مِنْ‌ بَعْدِ ذٰلِکَ‌ وَ أَصْلَحُوا إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ مِنْ‌ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه پروردگارت به کسانی که از روی نادانی کار زشت مرتکب شدند، و بعد از آن توبه کردند و [مفاسد خود را] اصلاح نمودند، [لطف و عنایت دارد] زیرا پروردگارت پس از آن [توبه و اصلاح] بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پروردگار تو براى كسانى كه از روى نادانى مرتكب كارى زشت شوند، سپس توبه كنند و به صلاح آيند، آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس پروردگار تو نسبت به كسانى كه از روى جهالت گناه كردند و آن‌گاه از پس آن توبه نمودند و درستكارى كردند، البته پروردگارت بعد از آن آمرزنده‌ى مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [با اين همه‌] پروردگار تو نسبت به كسانى كه به نادانى مرتكب گناه شده، سپس توبه كرده و به صلاح آمده‌اند، البته پروردگارت پس از آن آمرزنده مهربان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز هم خدا بر آنان که از روی جهالت و نادانی عمل زشتی انجام داده و سپس به درگاه او توبه کرده و (فساد آن عمل زشت را) اصلاح کنند، بعد از توبه خدا بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به هر حال، پروردگارت نسبت به کسانی که از روی حماقت و سفاهت (انسانی، و غفلت از عواقب امور به سبب غلبه‌ی شهوات نفسانی) کارهای بد می‌کنند و بعد از آن توبه می‌نمایند (و با انجام حسنات و عبادات به سوی خدا برمی‌گردند) و به اصلاح (حال و جبران گذشته‌ی خود) می‌پردازند، بس آمرزنده و مهربان است. [[«جَهَالَةٍ»: حماقت و سفاهت. نادانی (نگا: نساء / 17، انعام / 54).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه پروردگارت در حق کسانی که از روی نادانی مرتکب کار ناشایستی شده‌اند، و سپس توبه و درستکاری کرده‌اند، پس از آن، آمرزگار مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا پروردگارت نسبت به آنها که از روی جهالت، بدی کرده‌اند، سپس توبه کرده و در مقام جبران برآمده‌اند، پروردگارت بعد از آن آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس پروردگار تو برای آنان که انجام دادند بدی را به نادانی پس توبه کردند پس از آن و شایستگی گزیدند همانا پروردگار تو است از پس آن آمرزنده مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس پروردگار تو آنان را كه بدى به نادانى كردند آنگاه از پس آن بازگشتند- توبه نمودند- و به كار نيك و شايسته پرداختند هر آينه پروردگارت پس از آن آمرزگار و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس پروردگارت به راستی برای کسانی که به نادانی مرتکب گناه شدند، سپس بعد از آن توبه نموده و (گناهشان را جبران و) اصلاح کردند، البته پروردگارت پس از آن بسی پوشنده‌ی رحمتگر بر ویژگان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To those who do wrong out of ignorance, then repent and correct themselves, your Lord is indeed forgiving and kind.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then indeed your Lord – for those who unwittingly commit evil and then repent and reform themselves – indeed your Lord is then, surely, Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, surely thy Lord -- unto those who did evil in ignorance, then repented after that and put things right -- surely thy Lord thereafter is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then, verily, thy Lord unto those who work evil from ignorance, and then repent thereafter and amend, verily thy Lord thereafter is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, verily! Your Lord for those who do evil (commit sins and are disobedient to Allah) in ignorance and afterward repent and do righteous deeds, verily, your Lord thereafter, (to such) is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But towards those who do wrongs in ignorance, and then repent afterwards and reform, your Lord thereafter is Forgiving and Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But to those who commit evil out of ignorance and then repent and amend their ways, thereafter your Lord will be Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, your Lord for those who did evil out of ignorance and afterward repent and do righteous deeds - verily, after that, your Lord is Pardoning, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then lo! thy Lord - for those who do evil in ignorance and afterward repent and amend - lo! (for them) thy Lord is afterward indeed Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Moreover, your Lord will indeed be forgiving and merciful to those who repent after they having committed evil out of ignorance and reform themselves.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, your Lord to those who commit evil through ignorance and afterwards repent, and mend their ways your Lord thereafter is surely Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: To those who commit sins in their ignorance then repent and reform, your Lord is certainly All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Yet surely your Lord, with respect to those who do an evil in ignorance, then turn after that and make amends, most surely your Lord after that is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma inna rabbaka lillatheena AAamiloo alssooa bijahalatin thumma taboo min baAAdi thalika waaslahoo inna rabbaka min baAAdiha laghafoorun raheemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely, your Lord is most forgiving and ever merciful towards those who do evil in ignorance and truly repent thereafter and make amends.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But verily thy Lord,- to those who do wrong in ignorance, but who thereafter repent and make amends,- thy Lord, after all this, is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ إِبْرَاهِيمَ‌ کَانَ‌ أُمَّةً قَانِتاً لِلَّهِ‌ حَنِيفاً وَ لَمْ‌ يَکُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُشْرِکِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بدون تردید، ابراهیم [به تنهایی] یک امت بود، برای خدا از روی فروتنی فرمانبردار و [یکتاپرستی] حق گرا بود واز مشرکان نبود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ابراهيم بزرگوار مردى بود. به فرمان خدا بر پاى ايستاد و صاحب دين حنيف بود. و از مشركان نبود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى ابراهيم [به تنهايى‌] يك امت و مطيع خدا و موحد بود و از مشركان نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به راستى ابراهيم، پيشوايى مطيع خدا [و] حق‌گراى بود و از مشركان نبود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا ابراهیم (خلیل) امتی مطیع و فرمانبردار و یکتاپرست بود و هرگز به خدای یکتا شرک نیاورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ابراهیم (که شما مشرکان و شما یهودیان بدو می‌نازید) پیشوائی بود (جامع همه‌ی فضائل اخلاقی) و مطیع (فرمان الهی) و حقّگرای (بیزار از باطل و کناره‌گیر از بدیها) و او از زمره‌ی مشرکان (چون شما) نبوده است. [[«أُمَّةً»: قُدوه. پیشوا. از ماده (أَمَّهُ) به معنی (قَصَدَهُ) یا (إِقْتَدی بِهِ) است. فُعْلَة به معنی اسم مفعول است. مانند: نُخْبَة، رُحْلَة، دُخْلَة. به معنی: مُنْتَخَب، مَرْحُولٌ إِلَیْهِ، مَدْخُولٌ ... در صورت دوم، معنی آیه چنین می‌شود: ابراهیم یک ملّت بود. چرا که شعاع شخصیّت ابراهیم آن اندازه افزایش داشت که از یک فرد و دو فرد و یک گروه فراتر و معادل یک ملّت بود، و در خود کمالات و فضائلی را گرد آورده بود که اگر بر جماعت زیادی تقسیم می‌گردید، به یکایک ایشان می‌رسید. یا این که از آنجا که ابراهیم سرچشمه پیدایش امتی موحّد و یکتاپرست بوده به همین سبب نام امّت بر او گذارده شده است. «قَانِتاً»: مطیع و مداوم بر طاعت و عبادت خدا (نگا: بقره / 116 و 238، آل‌عمران / 17، زمر / 9). «حَنیفاً»: حقّگرا. مخلص فرمان خدا (نگا: بقره / 135، آل‌عمران / 67 و 95 ...).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان ابراهیم پیشوایی فروتن در برابر خداوند و پاکدین بود و از مشرکان نبود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ابراهیم (به تنهایی) امّتی بود مطیع فرمان خدا؛ خالی از هر گونه انحراف؛ و از مشرکان نبود؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ابراهیم بوده است پیشوائی فروتن برای خدا یکتاپرست و نبوده است از شرک‌ورزندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا ابراهيم [به تنهايى‌] يك امّت بود، خداى را با فروتنى فرمانبردار بود و حقّ‌گراى و يكتاپرست بود، و از مشركان نبود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌راستی ابراهیم (به تنهایی) امتی بود، خاضع و فرمان‌بردار خدا (و) از هر باطلی رویگردان بود و از مشرکان نبود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Abraham was certainly a model of faith, obedient to God and upright, and not one of idolaters,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed Ibrahim was a leader, obedient to Allah, and detached from all; and he was not a polytheist.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely, Abraham was a nation obedient unto God, a man of pure faith and no idolater,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily Ibrahim was a pattern, devout unto Allah, upright, and, not of the associaters.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was an Ummah (a leader having all the good righteous qualities), or a nation, obedient to Allah, Hanifa (i.e. to worship none but Allah), and he was not one of those who were Al-Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, and those who joined partners with Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Abraham was an exemplary leader, devoted to God, a monotheist, and was not of the polytheists.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, Ibrahim was (himself) an Ummah, obedient to Allah, a Hanif (monotheist), and he was not one of the idolators.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright, and he was not of the idolaters;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed Abraham was a nation [all by himself], obedient to Allah, a Hanif, and he was not a polytheist.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Abraham was (equal to) a nation, obedient to Allah, of pure faith and was not among the idolaters,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Abraham was, certainly, an obedient and upright person. He was not a pagan.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely Ibrahim was an exemplar, obedient to Allah, upright, and he was not of the polytheists.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna ibraheema kana ommatan qanitan lillahi haneefan walam yaku mina almushrikeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Abraham was a community in himself devoted to God and true in faith, He was not one of the polytheists;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:

verses.text: شَاکِراً لِأَنْعُمِهِ‌ اجْتَبَاهُ‌ وَ هَدَاهُ‌ إِلَى‌ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپاس گزار نعمت های او بود، خدا او را برگزید وبه راهی راست راهنمایی اش کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سپاسگزار نعمتهاى او بود، خداوندش برگزيد و به راه راست هدايت كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و شكرگزار نعمت‌هاى او بود و خدا او را برگزيد و به راهى راست هدايتش كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و] نعمتهاى او را شكرگزار بود. [خدا] او را برگزيد و به راهى راست هدايتش كرد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همیشه شکرگزار نعمتهای خدا بود که خدا او را (به رسالت) برگزید و به راه مستقیمش هدایت فرمود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او سپاسگزار نعمتهای خدا بود، (و به خاطر این خصال حمیده، خدا برای حمل رسالت) او را برگزید و به راه راست (منتهی به بهشت جاویدان و نعمت سرمدی یزدان) رهنمودش گردانید. [[«شَاکِراً»: خبر چهارم (کانَ) است. «إِجْتَبَاهُ»: او را برای رسالت آسمانی برگزید و وی را به دوستی گرفت (نگا: نساء / 125).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که در برابر نعمتهای او سپاسگزار بود [و خداوند] او را برگزید و به راه راست هدایت کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شکرگزار نعمتهای پروردگار بود؛ خدا او را برگزید؛ و به راهی راست هدایت نمود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپاسگزارنده نعمتهای او برگزیدش و رهبریش کرد بسوی راهی راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپاسدار نعمت‌هاى او بود، [خداى‌] او را برگزيد و به راه راست راه نمود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: حال آنکه نعمت‌هایش را شکرگزار بود، (خدا) او را برگزید و به راهی راست هدایتش فرمود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Grateful to Him for His favours; so He chose him and guided him to the path that is straight,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Grateful for His blessings; Allah chose him and guided him to the Straight Path.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: showing thankfulness for His blessings; He chose him, and He guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Grateful for His favours: He chose him and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (He was) thankful for His (Allah's) Graces. He (Allah) chose him (as an intimate friend) and guided him to a Straight Path (Islamic Monotheism, neither Judaism nor Christianity).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Thankful for His blessings. He chose him, and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He rendered thanks to Allah for His bounties so that Allah chose him (for His favours) and directed him to the Right Way.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (He was) thankful for His favors. He (Allah) chose him and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thankful for His bounties; He chose him and He guided him unto a straight path.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Grateful [as he was] for His blessings, He chose him and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: ever thankful for His favors. He chose him and He guided him to a Straight Path.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [He was] grateful for His favors. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He was thankful to God for His bounties. God chose him and guided him to the right path.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Grateful for His favors; He chose him and guided him on the right path.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Shakiran lianAAumihi ijtabahu wahadahu ila siratin mustaqeemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: he was thankful for His blessings. God chose him and guided him to a straight path.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He showed his gratitude for the favours of Allah, who chose him, and guided him to a Straight Way.

verses.text: وَ آتَيْنَاهُ‌ فِي‌ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَ إِنَّهُ‌ فِي‌ الْآخِرَةِ لَمِنَ‌ الصَّالِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به او در دنیا [زندگی نیکویی] دادیم، و بی تردید در آخرت از شایستگان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در دنيا به او نيكى عنايت كرديم و در آخرت از صالحان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و او را در دنيا نيكى داديم و بى‌ترديد در آخرت هم از شايستگان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در دنيا به او نيكويى و [نعمت‌] داديم و در آخرت [نيز] از شايستگان خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و او را در دنیا نیکویی (و سعادت) عطا کردیم و در آخرت از صالحان و نیکان خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و در دنیا نیکی بهره‌ی او کردیم و در آخرت هم از زمره‌ی شایستگان (نَیل به رضوان رحمان و ورود به بهشت جاویدان، یعنی نعمت فراوان و بی‌پایان) خواهد بود. [[«آتَیْناهُ فَِی الدُّنْیَا حَسَنَةً»: مراد محبّت مردمان جمیع ادیان در حق ابراهیم، و تولّد انبیاء فراوان از نسل او، و ذکر جمیل وی بر سر زبانها برای همیشه است (نگا: شعراء / 84، صافّات / 108 و 109).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به او در دنیا نیکی بخشیدیم و او در آخرت هم از شایستگان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما در دنیا به او (همّت) نیکویی دادیم؛ و در آخرت از نیکان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و دادیمش در دنیا نیکی و همانا او است در آخرت از شایستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را در اين جهان نيكويى داديم، و هر آينه در آن جهان از شايستگان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در دنیا به او (زندگی) نیکی دادیم و به‌راستی او در آخرت بی‌گمان از شایستگان (ویژه) است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And gave him what is good in the world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous and the good.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We gave him goodness in this world; and indeed in the Hereafter he is worthy of proximity.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We gave him in this world good, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We vouchsafed unto him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be of the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be of the righteous.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We gave him goodness in this world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We bestowed good upon him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall certainly be among the righteous.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be of the righteous.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We gave him good in the world, and in the Hereafter he is among the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We gave goodness to him in this world, and in the Everlasting Life he shall be amongst the righteous.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We granted him virtue in this life and he shall be among the righteous ones in the life to come.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We gave him good in this world, and in the next he will most surely be among the good.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waataynahu fee alddunya hasanatan wainnahu fee alakhirati lamina alssaliheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We gave him blessings in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be among the righteous.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We gave him Good in this world, and he will be, in the Hereafter, in the ranks of the Righteous.

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْکَ‌ أَنِ‌ اتَّبِعْ‌ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ‌ حَنِيفاً وَ مَا کَانَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُشْرِکِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه به تو وحی کردیم که از آیین [یکتاپرستیِ] ابراهیم حق گرا پیروی کن که از مشرکان نبود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به تو نيز وحى كرديم كه: از آيين حنيف ابراهيم پيروى كن كه او از مشركان نبود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس به تو وحى كرديم كه از آيين ابراهيم حق گراى پيروى كن، و او از مشركان نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس به تو وحى كرديم كه: «از آيين ابراهيم حق‌گراى پيروى كن، [چرا كه‌] او از مشركان نبود.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه بر تو وحی کردیم که (در دعوت به خداپرستی و توحید و بسط معارف الهی) آیین ابراهیم را تعقیب کن که پاک و یکتا پرست بود و هرگز به خدای یکتا شرک نیاورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس (قرنها بعد از ابراهیم، تو را به پیغمبری برگزیدیم) و به تو وحی کردیم که از آئین ابراهیم پیروی کن که حقگرا (و دور از انحراف) بود و از زمره‌ی مشرکان نبود. [[«مِلَّةَ»: دین. آئین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس به تو وحی کردیم که از آیین ابراهیم پاکدین پیروی کن که از مشرکان نبود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس به تو وحی فرستادیم که از آیین ابراهیم -که ایمانی خالص داشت و از مشرکان نبود- پیروی کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس وحی کردیم بسوی تو که پیروی کن آئین ابراهیم یکتاپرست را و نبود از شرک‌ورزان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس به تو وحى كرديم كه آيين ابراهيم حق‌گراى را پيروى كن، و او از مشركان نبود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس فراسوی تو وحی کردیم که: « از آیین ابراهیم - در حالی که رویگردان از باطل بود - پیروی کن حال آنکه از مشرکان نبود.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We commanded you to follow the way of Abraham the upright who was not of idolaters.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And then We sent you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) the divine revelation that, “Follow the religion of Ibrahim, who was free from all falsehood; and was not a polytheist.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We revealed to thee: 'Follow thou the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith and no idolater.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Afterwards We revealed unto thee: follow thou the faith of Ibrahim the upright; and he was not of the associaters.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, We have inspired you (O Muhammad SAW saying): "Follow the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham) Hanifa (Islamic Monotheism - to worship none but Allah) and he was not of the Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We inspired you: “Follow the religion of Abraham, the Monotheist. He was not an idol-worshiper.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then We revealed to you: "Follow the way of Abraham with exclusive devotion to Allah. He was not one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, We have sent the revelation to you: "Follow the religion of Ibrahim (he was a) Hanif, and he was not one of the idolators."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And afterward We inspired thee (Muhammad, saying): Follow the religion of Abraham, as one by nature upright. He was not of the idolaters.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereafter We revealed to you [saying], ‘Follow the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, who was not a polytheist.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, We revealed to you: 'Follow the Creed of Abraham, he of pure faith, he was not among the idolaters'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent you, (Muhammad), a revelation that you should follow the tradition of Abraham, the upright one, who was not a pagan.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We revealed to you: Follow the faith of Ibrahim, the upright one, and he was not of the polytheists.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma awhayna ilayka ani ittabiAA millata ibraheema haneefan wama kana mina almushrikeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We revealed Our will to you [O Muhammad], saying, "Follow the religion of Abraham, the upright in faith; he was not one of the polytheists."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So We have taught thee the inspired (Message), "Follow the ways of Abraham the True in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah."

verses.text: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ‌ السَّبْتُ‌ عَلَى‌ الَّذِينَ‌ اخْتَلَفُوا فِيهِ‌ وَ إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ لَيَحْکُمُ‌ بَيْنَهُمْ‌ يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ فِيمَا کَانُوا فِيهِ‌ يَخْتَلِفُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [تحریم ماهی گیری در] روز شنبه فقط برای کسانی که در آن [از نظر آزادی و ممنوعیت کار] اختلاف کردند، قرار داده شده است، و بی تردید پروردگارت در روز قیامت درباره آنچه در آن اختلاف می کردند، داوری خواهد کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شنبه گرفتن را براى كسانى كه در آن اختلاف كرده بودند قرار داده‌اند، و پروردگار تو در روز قيامت در باره آنچه اختلاف مى‌كردند حكم خواهد كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
